Primacy Requirements

• States must enact laws and promulgate regulations at least as stringent as EPA’s • States must have procedures in place for implementing and enforcing regulations: – Inventory – Sanitary surveys – State certified laboratory – Plan review – Enforcement authority

Lead and Copper Rule
Lead and Copper Rule

• Applies to CWSs and NTNCWSs • Requires monitoring at customers’ taps • If lead or copper levels exceed the action level, systems may need to: – Treat source water – Add corrosion control – Establish a public education program – Replace lead service lines
• Applies to CWSs and NTNCWSs • A p p l i e s
